items.title: Tax Planning for Medical Clinics: the power of hospital equalization
items.excerpt: See how clinics and healthcare services can significantly reduce their tax burden through hospital equalization, with security and planning.
content: Hospital equalization is a tax strategy that allows medical clinics and healthcare services to be taxed more favorably, equating to the rules applicable to hospitals.
This possibility is provided for in Brazilian legislation and can represent significant savings in the payment of federal taxes, especially IRPJ and CSLL.
To benefit from this equalization, the clinic needs to meet specific requirements related to physical structure, services provided, and the form of legal constitution.
Our team of specialists analyzes each case individually to verify eligibility and implement the necessary changes with full legal security.

items.title: Tax Planning for Retail and E-commerce: how to pay less taxes
items.excerpt: Understand the main points of attention for physical stores and e-commerces that want to structure tax planning and reduce costs with taxes.
content: The retail sector, both physical and digital, faces a complex tax burden that includes PIS, COFINS, ICMS, and ICMS-ST. A well-planned tax structure can generate significant savings.
For e-commerces, it is essential to understand the particularities of interstate ICMS and tax substitution, which vary according to the state of origin and destination of goods.
The choice of the appropriate tax regime — Simples Nacional, Presumed Profit, or Real Profit — must be made based on detailed analysis of revenue, margins, and operations.
Our team follows the constant changes in legislation to ensure that your company is always in compliance and taking advantage of all savings opportunities.

items.title: Understanding PL 1.087/2025: new taxation on profits and high incomes
items.excerpt: Summary of the main changes proposed by PL 1.087/2025 and their impacts for entrepreneurs and high-income individuals.
content: Bill 1.087/2025 proposes significant changes in the taxation of profits and dividends distributed by companies, in addition to creating new rates for high-income individuals.
Among the main changes, the possibility of taxing dividends that are currently exempt stands out, which can directly impact the compensation structure of partners and shareholders.
The project also provides for adjustments in Income Tax rates for different income brackets, seeking greater progressivity in the Brazilian tax system.
It is essential that entrepreneurs and managers follow the processing of this project and evaluate, in advance, possible adjustments in their corporate and profit distribution structures.

items.title: eSocial 2025: main changes and how to prepare
items.excerpt: Learn about eSocial updates for 2025 and how to keep your company in compliance with new labor requirements.
content: eSocial continues to evolve and bring new requirements for Brazilian companies. In 2025, some important changes come into effect.
The main changes include new events related to occupational health and safety, as well as adjustments in information submission deadlines.
Companies that do not adapt to the new rules may face significant fines and penalties.
Our team is prepared to help your company adapt to new requirements, ensuring compliance and avoiding problems with inspection.

items.title: Tax Reform: what changes for your company
items.excerpt: A complete summary of the changes proposed by the tax reform and how they can affect different sectors of the economy.
content: The Brazilian tax reform promises to simplify the tax system, unifying taxes such as PIS, COFINS, ICMS, and ISS into a single value-added tax.
The transition will be gradual, with an adaptation period expected for the coming years, allowing companies to prepare for the changes.
Sectors such as services, retail, and industry will be impacted in different ways, requiring specific analysis for each type of business.
Closely monitoring these changes and planning ahead is essential to minimize negative impacts and take advantage of possible benefits.

items.title: How to organize your company's cash flow
items.excerpt: Practical tips for implementing efficient cash flow control and improving your business's financial health.
content: Cash flow is one of the most important tools for the financial management of any company, regardless of size.
Efficient control allows you to predict periods of financial tightness, plan investments, and make more assertive decisions.
The correct categorization of revenues and expenses, combined with realistic projections, forms the basis of good cash control.
Our financial management consultancy can help your company implement processes and tools for efficient cash control.
